item.title: Statstics 101
item.author: judah@joodaloop.com (Judah)
item.description: Taken together (diminishing information from data, diminishing decision-making value from information), the marginal decision-making value of data drops rapidly. Which is to say, a majority of the decision-making value from “Big Data” can be gleaned from just a small subset. In fact, that is the entire point of statistics — figuring out how much information can be derived from a sample of data randomly chosen from a larger population.
